Articles.Content:
So, has this been attempted before?

No jets, no engines, no electric. Just the flexibility of cold steel.

One day a Kerbal will reach the orbit through power of springs alone. But today, the first steps: The Catapult.![IcgNPKD.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/IcgNPKD.jpg)

![ilikQYH.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/ilikQYH.jpg)

![IoTZQjO.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/IoTZQjO.jpg)

![XhApXYd.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/XhApXYd.jpg)

![eWCxmjT.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/eWCxmjT.jpg)

![r6YOHsn.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/r6YOHsn.jpg)![qX7f4wn.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/qX7f4wn.jpg)![cxAnxSz.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/cxAnxSz.jpg)![Dkku0zS.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/Dkku0zS.jpg)![A9CWwBT.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/A9CWwBT.jpg)![zKlhabn.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/zKlhabn.jpg)

![Qp4w23u.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/Qp4w23u.jpg)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-11T19:02:29Z" title="06/11/2015 07:02  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 11, 2015</time> by Sharpy**
This is amazing, as I was thinking about using springs in space stations to deorbit spacecraft just hours ago.

> 
> This is amazing, as I was thinking about using springs in space stations to deorbit spacecraft just hours ago.

for every action...

I think Xacktar made a trebuchet, let me try to dig that up...

Cant find it. someone did though, it was featured on one of the daily things.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-11T19:54:45Z" title="06/11/2015 07:54  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 11, 2015</time> by r4pt0r**

> 
> for every action...

And that's why I recognized it as not useful.
KSP is not Besiege. Just FYI.

How does it work? I mean know there's energy stored in flexing joints, but I don't see how you .... it, so to speak.

EDIT Oh, I see now.

EDIT2 Dang you, autocensor! That's an actual word in this context!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-11T20:16:50Z" title="06/11/2015 08:16  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 11, 2015</time> by pincushionman**

> 
> KSP is not Besiege. Just FYI.

0/10 needs more peasants Kerbals
Ok, this is awesome. Rep to you.
